newsitem.title: USA: Reader's Digest to meet EPS expectations.
newsitem.headline: Reader's Digest to meet EPS expectations.

text.p: James P. Schadt, chairman of Reader's Digest Association Inc, said the company expects the improving trend in its quarter-to-quarter results to continue and meet expectations for earnings per share.
In a statement, Schadt said the $0.78 earnings per share for the second quarter ended Dec 31 were in line with market expectations and showed a marked improvement over the first quarter.

He said the company expects modest full-year operating profit growth compared to last year, saying while customer and revenue-led growth in the latter part of the year was anticipated, momentum going into next year may not be as great as previously indicated.
"The turnaround of our European operations is taking even longer than we originally expected," he said, but said the company is convinced it is on the right track worldwide.
At the same time, the company said recent promotional mailings resulted in lower than anticipated customer responses.
